subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 6, 2007

TOP STORIESTB Patient: No One Said I Couldn't Travel
The globe-trotting tuberculosis patient now in quarantine insists that doctors told him he wasn't contagious. Not so, say
                        health officials: He was told he was not highly contagious, but they told Congress they couldn't stop him from traveling. More...Watch: TB Patient: No Order To Stay
• Missing Conn. Girl Found In Couple's Home• Turkish Officials: Troops Enter Iraq
                     					| Watch• Top Diabetes Doc Says Glaxo Threatened Him
                     					| WatchU.S.Missing Conn. Girl Found In Couple's Home
A 15-year-old girl missing for nearly a year was found locked in a small hidden room under the staircase of a West Hartford
                        home, police said. More...
• Video May Have Clues In Missing Teen Case
                     					| Watch• Divorce American Style: Wife Gets $184M• Property Row Over Flight 93 Memorial Site• More StoriesWorldTurkish Officials: Troops Enter Iraq
Senior Turkish security officials said Turkish troops crossed into northern Iraq in "hot pursuit" of Kurdish rebels. Turkey's
                        foreign minister denied the report, while the Pentagon said there were "no indications" of any cross-border activity. More...Watch: Petraeus On Progress In Iraq
• Israeli-Palestinian Summit Canceled• Man Tries To Jump Into Popemobile
                     					| Watch• Bush: "Russia Is Not An Enemy"
                     					| Watch• More StoriesPoliticsImmigration Deal Survives GOP Threat
A bipartisan immigration bill narrowly survived a potentially fatal challenge when the Senate defeated a Republican bid to
                        bar felons from legalization. Instead, it adopted an amendment that would keep out a more limited set of criminals. More...Watch: Immigration Reform Debate
• Pardon Me?
                     					| Watch• GOP Debate Forecasts Stormy Days Ahead
                     					| Watch• TB Patient: No One Said I Couldn't Travel
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthGood News For Discouraged Dieters?
Finally, some good news for disheartened dieters led to believe that the pounds they lose are destined to return. Far from
                        being impossible, new research from the CDC suggests that maintaining weight loss is not all that uncommon. More...Watch: Which Diets Really Work?
• Rolling Into The ER• Top Diabetes Doc Says Glaxo Threatened Him
                     					| Watch• Kids' Internet Safety Starts At Home• More StoriesSciTechStem Cell Breakthrough?
Three teams of scientists say they have produced the equivalent of embryonic stem cells, at least in mice, without taking
                        the controversial step of destroying embryos. More...
• NASA Head Sorry For Global Warming Doubts• Brazil's Ethanol-Fueled Power Grab• Mass Evacuations As Cyclone Gonu Hits Oman• More StoriesBusinessFord Shines In Vehicle Quality Rankings
Ford supplanted Toyota as the leader of the pack in initial quality rankings, taking the top spot in five of 19 segments in
                        the 2007 survey by J.D. Power and Associates, released Wednesday. More...
• Four Ways To Lower Cooling Costs• Sirius, XM Hire High-Profile Lobbyists• Brazil's Ethanol-Fueled Power Grab• More StoriesEntertainmentTherapists Upset Over "Sopranos"
"The Sopranos," once lauded for its accurate portrayal of Tony's therapy sessions, is taking heat from members of the psychoanalytical
                        community, saying last Sunday's episode broke with ethics. More...
• Paris Hilton "Crying" Behind Bars• Gisele Bundchen Opposes Condom Ban• Jolie: Brad And I Want To "Just Live"• More StoriesOpinionTurning The Tables On Climate Change
President Bush's announcement of a conference of greenhouse-gas emitters may head off a European attempt to cripple the American
                        economy, which has succeeded in growing even as it pollutes less, says National Review Online. More...Watch: Bush Proposes G-8 Climate Pact
• Serious Crime, Serious Punishment
                     					| Watch• Sometimes The Question Is Secondary
                     					| Watch• Harry Potter & The Continuous Exploitation• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSThe Early Show: Emily Senay: Folic Acid Study Yields Unexpected Result
Folic acid is a B vitamin that women take to prevent birth defects. Scientists have thought that folic assist might have some
                        other benefits but as Dr. Emily Senay reports, new research in one area has not panned out. More...Watch: Pros & Cons Of Folic Acid 
• EARLY SHOW: Beware Of Internet Puppy Scam

Di Aide Is OK With DocumentaryOnly On The Web: Patrick Jephson, the former private secretary to Princess Diana, said he found nothing objectionable
                                    about a new documentary about her tragic death.
